text:
Meade is a city in Meade County, Kansas, United States. It is also the county seat of Meade County. In 2010, 1,721 people lived there.
History.
Meade was planned out and incorporated in 1885. It was named after Gen. George Meade.
Geography.
The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
Weather.
The Köppen Climate Classification system says that Meade has a semi-arid climate, abbreviated "BSk" on climate maps.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 1,721 people, 670 households, and 454 families living in Meade.
